item.title: Gobuster Web Application Attack
item.description: What is Gobuster? Gobuster is a Linux command line tool used to view all hidden pages of a website. Some websites will leave admin panels unprotected, leaving them vulnerable for us to attack. For this, will will be using a TryHackMe website called fakebank.com, so lets get into it. Note, this will not work if you use a general Linux Terminal, you must use the TryHackMe room. Initiating the attack To begin the attack, we are going to open the Terminal and type in the follow command:

item.title: Startup
item.description: I have just recently created this blog, and I am testing out whether the post system works. I am unsure as to whether it will, but I hope it does. As to how I am making this blog, refer to below as I will explain exactly so. What to expect in this blog is a curious question, as I will do all the sorts. News, tutorials, how-tos, showcases, and generally me just doing a post on what I am doing at that moment in time.
